intro: Asphodeline damascena subsp. ovoidea, commonly known as the egg-shaped asphodel, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and striking, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant produces small, egg-shaped bulbs that are used for propagation. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and drought tolerance.
